importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the news article's publication, indicating when the passing of Doug Martin was announced publicly.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: Doug Martin's NFL career spanned from 2012 to 2018, with key achievements occurring during this period, including Pro Bowl appearances and All-Pro honors.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at the age of 36.
Martin was selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL draft after a standout college career at Boise State.
He rushed for 1,454 yards and 11 touchdowns as a rookie, earning a Pro Bowl berth.
In 2015, he recorded 1,402 yards and six touchdowns, earning Pro Bowl and first-team All-Pro honors.
Martin finished his career with 5,356 yards rushing and 30 touchdowns across six seasons with the Buccaneers and one with the Raiders.
He also had 148 receptions for 1,207 yards and two touchdowns.
The Tampa Bay Buccaneers released a statement expressing deep sorrow over his passing and acknowledging his lasting impact on the franchise.
Martin was recognized as one of the top 50 players in Buccaneers franchise history during the team's 50th anniversary celebration.
The cause of death is currently unconfirmed, and the family has asked for privacy during this time.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, has died at the age of 36. Selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL draft from Boise State, Martin had a standout career with the Buccaneers, rushing for 5,356 yards and 30 touchdowns, and earning Pro Bowl and first-team All-Pro honors in 2015. He was recognized as one of the top 50 players in franchise history during the Buccaneers’ 50th anniversary celebration. The team expressed deep sorrow over his passing, calling it a significant loss to the franchise. The cause of death remains unconfirmed, and the family has asked for privacy.
title: Former Buccaneers All-Pro Running Back Doug Martin Dies at 36
